_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The three wild colts [an3.140:6.9]: Fast, but not beautiful or well-proportioned
Fast and beautiful, but not well-proportioned
The three wild people [an3.140:6.9]: Fast, but not beautiful or well-proportioned
Fast and beautiful, but not well-proportioned
How a wild person is fast, but not beaut: They truly understand "This is the origin of suffering"
They truly understand "This is the cessation of suffering"
They truly understand "This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering"
They falter without answering when asked a question about the teaching or training
They don't receive robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick
How a wild person is fast and beautiful,: They truly understand "This is the origin of suffering"
They truly understand "This is the cessation of suffering"
They truly understand "This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering"
They answer without faltering when asked a question about the teaching or training
They don't receive robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick
How a wild person is fast, beautiful, an: They truly understand "This is the origin of suffering"
They truly understand "This is the cessation of suffering"
They truly understand "This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering"
They answer without faltering when asked a question about the teaching or training
They receive robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
